title: Soft monolinear tech sans on Dazed cover
content:
Hi there!  
Here i am again to ask you for a font.  
A friend knowing that i talk in this forum asked me to see if i can find this font.  
It seems known to me but i cant identify it so please help me.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205102538im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/wth_4650.jpg)

Thanks  
Joel Santos,  
youremin

 [‹ (x) Acne Jeans 70s serif face - Times Modern {Marten F}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205102538/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41573 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Design Museum's Re-Magazine grotesque sans - customized FF/AG Schoolbook {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205102538/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41568 "Go to next forum topic")
author: youremin

comments.content:
Looks a lot like what Kulander Mantilla is using over on another node [http://typophile.com/node/41417](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205102538/http:/typophile.com/node/41417 "http://typophile.com/node/41417")  
Cheers
It looks like Gotham Rounded, but the A is narrower.

In [an earlier thread about Dazed](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205102538/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33553) you’ll find some alternatives. I think the closest one is [Gravostyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205102538/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=1&id_font=17) from Optimo...

i see i’ll tell her thanks ...

Joel Santos // youremin  
sound & visual
